By mentioning the God of their fathers, Paul acknowledges the faith of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, emphasizing that the Christian doctrine is not contrary to their belief in the one God of Israel. Ananias, in his message to Paul, reveals that God has chosen him to know His will, see the Righteous One, and hear a voice from His mouth. This appointment signifies God's predestination and preparation of Paul for his service, enabling him to understand and proclaim the plan of salvation. Paul's encounter with the risen Lord, his hearing of His voice, and his recognition of Jesus as the Just One further validate his apostleship.
